result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond E Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Bribery of Witness [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.61(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No contact with victim or co-actors.
No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with the Probation Department.
Provide a DNA sample.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raymond E Harris in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Raymond E Harris in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for Ron Dague for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  1  YEAR at the House of Corrections, straight time with 134 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.
  Conditions of Probation
- no contact with victim or co-actors
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- Absolute sobriety
- Random urine screens
- Provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Pay DNA surcharges;
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Attorney Richard Henry Hart in court, defendant Raymond E Harris not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Branch 19 is in jury trial.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's List of Proposed Jury Instructions, Defendant's List of potential Witness, received and filed. tk

Attorney Richard Henry Hart in court, defendant Raymond E Harris not in court, in custody.  Patrick Anderson for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motions in Limine received and filed.

Defendant Raymond E Harris in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Defendant Raymond E Harris in custody.  Ronald Dague for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Shontell Harris and her residence.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Raymond E Harris in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Raymond E Harris in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
